pullRequest.body:
Upstreamed from the [PFR](https://github.com/teorth/pfr) project.

From PFR, Carleson, GibbsMeasure

Co-authored-by: Heather Macbeth <25316162+hrmacbeth@users.noreply.github.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [45dea6e231](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18034/commits/45dea6e231ddf1cfeb76aa5493ee469e3f1c544a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4257 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 179511 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ PositivityForAesop`
`+ ofNat_lt_top`
`+ ofNat_ne_top`
`- one_ne_top`
`- zero_ne_top`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
That tactic was written for PFR: https://github.com/teorth/pfr/blob/master/PFR/Tactic/Finiteness.lean

Ops, didn't know that. Thanks @RemyDegenne.

I'll update the description.
Glad I checked the list of PRs. I was about to upstream it from PFR ðŸ˜…
Do you mind if I touch this PR? I think you're doing it wrong with the imports

> Do you mind if I touch this PR? I think you're doing it wrong with the imports

No problem @YaelDillies. Can you then tell me what's wrong with the imports?

> Glad I checked the list of PRs. I was about to upstream it from PFR ðŸ˜… 

Sorry. I initially thought it was developed for Carleson, but then I added this PR to the PFR Zulip topic ["Upstream to Mathlib"](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/412902-Polynomial-Freiman-Ruzsa-conjecture/topic/Upstream.20to.20Mathlib) a few hours ago.

Looks great by me now.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Ci failed returning the following warning and error message: 

```console
Warning: ././././Mathlib/Order/BoundedOrder.lean:9:1: warning: unused import (use `lake exe shake --fix` to fix this, or `lake exe shake --update` to ignore)
././././Mathlib/Order/BoundedOrder.lean:
  remove #[Mathlib.Tactic.Finiteness.Attr]
Error: The process '/usr/bin/env' failed with exit code 1
```

I have just run `lake exe shake --update`.

Please add a test file.  You can start with the examples here:
https://github.com/teorth/pfr/blob/ee35aa0228d40a96b36dff66e10b5f420770856e/PFR/Tactic/Finiteness.lean#L65
I think the usual rule set pattern would give `finiteness` here rather than `Finiteness`?
I can understand why you want to avoid `intros`, but why `assumption`?
Hmm, not sure. @hrmacbeth, did you have a specific rationale here?
I don't remember, but looking now at the `aesop` docs, it seems that the `-50` is a *penalty*, i.e. (since it is negative) actually an incentive to apply these rules.
Oh! In that case I need to flip my question - why is `intros` given such a high incentive; it seems like introducing the hypothesis `x = âŠ¤` would be unhelpful?
@pitmonticone Can you consult with @JLimperg about whether there is a way to get this working?
Sure, I'll get back to this tomorrow evening.

I have since learned that there is a better syntax for this, something like (untested)
```suggestion
  liftMetaFinishingTactic Mathlib.Meta.Positivity.positivity
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Tactic): add `finiteness` tactic
